document.discussion_title: Prince's private jet pilot requested medical help days before singers death
document.topic_text: 6 shares 19 View comments Audio between the pilot of Prince's jet and ground control revealed medical personnel would be present as soon as the plane landed Audio has emerged of the moment a pilot transporting Prince on a flight six days prior to his death requested emergency medical treatment for his passenger. The audio reveals the pilot was requesting permission to land in Moline, Illinois where a 'certified first responder' would be waiting on the tarmac. Obtained by TMZ , the recording details how traffic controllers organised for the plane to land on the airport's 'north ramp' during the emergency. They also ask if the passenger is male or female, suggesting his identity was not revealed during the call. He had been suffering from flu for a number of weeks and was believed to be recovering, but took a turn for the worse. It comes as the legendary singer's brother-in-law reportedly claimed Prince did not sleep for six days prior to his death. And he also appeared 'pale' and 'weak' during one of his last public appearances, witnesses said. Employees at Electric Fetus record shop in Minneapolis said the musician did not look 'in the best shape' when he visited the store five days before he was found at his Paisley Park estate. Prince's brother-in-law Maurice Phillips reportedly claimed the singer had worked for six days without sleep when friends and family held a private service at the compound on Saturday. Mr Phillips, who is married to Prince's sister Tyka Nelson, is said to have told fans outside Paisley Park: 'He worked 154 hours straight. I was with him just last weekend. He was a good brother-in-law.' 2 Next 'These stupid skits actually dishonor the Great Man's... The moment Prince's ashes were carried out beneath a jacket... EXCLUSIVE: 'Has anyone ever told you that you look a lot... Max Timander, who works at Electric Fetus, said Prince visited a day after the Purple Rain star was rushed to hospital when his plane made an emergency landing in Atlanta, Georgia. TMZ reported that he had overdosed on a painkiller called Percocet at the time. Mr Timander told the Press Association: 'Everyone I've talked to on that Saturday said he looked kind of pale and he was not totally looking in the best shape as he normally is. 'It sounded like he was looking kind of weak. I know he had just got over the flu supposedly.' The mayor of Chanhassen, the city which is home to Paisley Park, said discussions were taking place to stage a public service in honour of Prince in the Minneapolis area. 'It's clear his friends and family would support the idea,' Denny Laufenburger said. A private funeral service at a local church is expected to take place in early May, he added. Prince was found collapsed in a lift by staff members on Thursday morning, more than 12 hours after he was last seen alive when he was dropped off at Paisley Park. The 57-year-old singer was pronounced dead at the scene. The 57-year-old singer (pictured in 2011) was found dead at his Paisley Park home on Thursday morning
